metadata.synopsis: Jackie (Karen Sillas) is an executive assistant. Michael (Tom Noonan) is a paralegal. By day, they work together at the same law firm, but tonight they're on their first date. He's a tall man with an intense look that some would find intimidating, but she is intrigued by him, and the two spend an evening in deep discussion, each performing the necessary verbal footwork to find out as much about the other as possible. As they dig deeper into each other's pasts, they make startling discoveries.

reviews: This intense, mysterious drama about a date between two lonely misfits, is sensitively directed by Tom Noonan, better known as an actor; it was the surprise winner of the Grand Jury Prize of the 1994 Sundance Film Festival.
More like a bad real first date than a movie.
Absorbing character-based drama that yields plenty of nuances and variations on its simple premise.
A darky amusing but sadly poignant look at dating and deception.
Brilliantly executed psychodrama about all the emotions that come to the fore in dating.
This one really moves and breathes.
There are many small moments of perfect observation. But I never really felt they were building to anything, or heading anywhere.
